intro: Wisteria sinensis var. multijuga, commonly known as the Chinese wisteria, is a deciduous climbing vine native to China. It features long, pendulous clusters of fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has compound leaves composed of 12–20 oval-shaped leaflets, and its stems are covered in visible, woody tendrils. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is known for its ornamental value but can be invasive in certain climates if not properly managed.
